events.name: Blockchain+ IoT with Freshturf  & IBM
events.description: Blockchain and IoT both are getting aggressive traction among various industries in their own ways in recent years. While Blockchain is a shared ledger technology, IoT is a concept of connected solutions. In this session we will discuss how Blockchain will enable the realization of many IoT solutions. Speakers  Nikolay Vlasov, Senior Consultant, IBM Cloud (Blockchain Garage Team) During this session we will explore the topic of using blockchain technology for Internet of Things solutions. After a quick overview of key characteristics of blockchain we will discuss how those will help to increase security and transparency of IoT-enabled business processes in comparison with other distributed database systems. As an example we will explore one of the projects that has been done in IBM Blockchain Garage in Singapore and then will take a glimpse into a possible future directions for blockchain and IoT.  Kevin Lim, Cofounder, Freshturf During this session Kevin will share Freshturf’s journey as an IoT startup which took up a challenge to address the last mile delivery services using Blockchain + IoT. FreshTurf is a startup in Singapore that wanted to apply new technology to track delivery shipments, with dedicated storage lockers linked up through a distributed ledger platform. The company’s goal was to provide a “last mile” solution for consumers looking to keep track of their packages more easily and pick up their packages at a remote site. ************************************************************  DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 11th May 2017 • 06:30 pm – Registration & Networking • 06:50 pm – Introduction by CK  • 07:00 pm – Talk by Nikolay Vlasov • 07:40 pm – Talk by Kevin Lim • 08:20 pm –  QnA  • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01, SG139951 ************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: GA x NTUC: Intro to Coding: HTML & CSS
events.description:
Sign up for free here: ga.co/2pkAhXj

Instructor: Prima Aulia Gusta (Web Developer Instructor, General Assembly)

Meet the programming languages that power the web, and write your first line of code.
Step into the world of web development with General Assembly. During our introductory workshop, explore the building blocks of the web — HTML and CSS — and learn how you can apply these programming languages to develop your own simple sites. By writing your own lines of code, you’ll:
- Get a closer look at how the developer community and many different fields benefit from coding knowledge.
- Learn how HTML and CSS function together to form the backbone of the web.
- Cover key coding terms and principles.
- Develop a custom, working web page from scratch.

Chart your own career path. Pick up where this workshop leaves off. Design and build a custom site online in our mentor-guided HTML, CSS, & Web Design Circuit. Incorporate JavaScript and code dynamic sites in our part-time, on-campus Front-End Web Development course. Or, go all-in and become a job-ready developer our 12-week, full-time Web Development Immersive program, available on campus and online.

Prereqs & Preparation

A laptop is required for this workshop. For those on Windows, you’ll need Microsoft Windows 7/8/10 (32- or 64-bit). For those with Macs, you’ll need the Mac OS X 10.8.5 or higher, up to 10.11.4 (El Capitan). Upgrade your operating system before class, if needed. Basic technical aptitude and orientation to computers, and curiosity to learn new tools. Download Sublime Text 3.
